content.description: The recreation committee of a certain town is interested in creating a new nature trail for walkers, runners, and bikers. A random sample of <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> town residents were asked whether they are in favor of creating the new trail. Of those sampled, <math alttext="78" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>78</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> said yes.
content.question: What is the population of interest for which the committee can generalize its conclusions?

choices.label: The <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> town residents who were asked about whether they are in favor of creating the new trail
The <math alttext="78" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>78</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> town residents who responded that they are in favor of creating the new trail
All town residents who are walkers, runners, or bikers
All town residents who are in favor of the new trail

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
